title.value: Contrast-agnostic Spinal Cord Segmentation: A Comparative Study of ConvNets and Vision Transformers
title.justification: The title is explicitly mentioned in the beginning of the paper.
title.quote: Contrast-agnostic Spinal Cord Segmentation: A Comparative Study of ConvNets and Vision Transformers

extractions.description: This paper presents a comparative study on the performance of convolutional neural networks (ConvNets) and vision transformers (ViTs) in the task of contrast-agnostic spinal cord segmentation. The study uses a fixed dataset size and evaluates seven different deep learning models to determine their effectiveness in producing robust spinal cord segmentations across various MRI contrasts.

type.justification: The paper involves experimental comparisons of different deep learning models for a specific task, and thus is empirical.
type.quote: In this study, we extend our recent work (Bédard et al., 2023) by evaluating the contrast-agnostic SC segmentation capabilities of different classes of DL architectures.

name.justification: The paper focuses on medical imaging techniques, specifically spinal cord segmentation using deep learning models.
name.quote: Keywords: Spinal Cord, MRI, Contrasts, Segmentation, Deep Learning, CNNs, Vision Transformers

name.justification: The study involves deep learning models such as ConvNets and vision transformers for segmentation tasks.
name.quote: In this study, we extend our recent work (Bédard et al., 2023) by evaluating the contrast-agnostic SC segmentation capabilities of different classes of DL architectures, namely, ConvNeXt, vision transformers (ViTs), and hierarchical ViTs.

name.justification: The paper deals with vision tasks related to segmentation in medical imaging, which falls under the scope of computer vision.
name.quote: The segmentation is essentially a computer vision task applied in the medical domain.

name.justification: The model is specifically mentioned as one of the CNNs compared in the study.
name.quote: In CNNs, we compared DeepSeg 2D (Gros et al., 2018) (implemented in the open-source Spinal Cord Toolbox (De Leener et al., 2017))

is_contributed.justification: DeepSeg 2D is cited as a model used for comparison, not as a novel contribution by the authors.

is_executed.justification: The model was executed to compare its performance against other models.

is_compared.justification: The performance of DeepSeg 2D was compared with other models in the paper.

referenced_paper_title.value: Automatic segmentation of the spinal cord and intramedullary multiple sclerosis lesions with convolutional neural networks
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper for DeepSeg 2D is noted in the study.

name.justification: The nnUNet is identified as one of the models compared in the research.

is_contributed.justification: nnUNet is used for comparison, not a new contribution in this paper.

is_executed.justification: The nnUNet was used in experiments presented in the paper.
is_executed.quote: we compared 7 models spanning 3 different classes of DL architectures.

is_compared.justification: nnUNet's performance is compared against other models in the study.
is_compared.quote: Among the CNN-based models, the contrast-agnostic model achieved the lowest CSA error, with MedNeXt following closely.

referenced_paper_title.value: nnU-Net: a self-configuring method for deep learning-based biomedical image segmentation
referenced_paper_title.justification: The study mentions this reference in relation to nnUNet.

name.justification: MedNeXt is evaluated as part of the ConvNeXt models compared in the paper.
name.quote: Then, we trained MedNeXt (Roy et al., 2023), a state-of-the-art ConvNeXt model designed for 3D medical images.

is_contributed.justification: MedNeXt is a model cited from other sources, not introduced by the authors.

is_executed.justification: MedNeXt was specifically trained and evaluated in the experiments.

is_compared.justification: MedNeXt was compared against other models in the research findings.

referenced_paper_title.value: Mednext: Transformer-driven scaling of convnets for medical image segmentation
referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper references this title for MedNeXt.

name.justification: UNETR is one of the ViTs compared in the study.
name.quote: among ViTs, we compared three models, namely, UNETR (Hatamizadeh et al., 2021)

is_contributed.justification: UNETR is a previously developed model and not a new contribution by the authors.

is_executed.justification: UNETR was implemented to generate experimental results.
is_executed.quote: among ViTs, we compared three models, namely, UNETR...

is_compared.justification: UNETR's performance metrics were compared with other models in the paper.
is_compared.quote: while the SwinUNETR models showed similar performance as the CNNs.

referenced_paper_title.value: UNETR: Transformers for 3D medical image segmentation
referenced_paper_title.justification: This is the reference provided for UNETR in the study.

name.justification: SwinUNETR model is evaluated in the study as one of the hierarchical ViTs.

is_contributed.justification: SwinUNETR is sourced from existing literature and is not a novel model from this study.

is_executed.justification: SwinUNETR was used in the experiments to assess its performance.

is_compared.justification: SwinUNETR's performance was directly compared against other models in the study.
is_compared.quote: while the SwinUNETR models showed similar performance as the CNNs.

referenced_paper_title.value: Swin UNETR: Swin transformers for semantic segmentation of brain tumors in MRI images
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper is noted for SwinUNETR.

name.justification: The study mentions a contrast-agnostic model developed in previous work which was compared in this paper.

is_contributed.quote: and our recently-introduced contrast-agnostic model (Bédard et al., 2023).

is_executed.justification: The contrast-agnostic model was executed as part of the experiments in this paper.
is_executed.quote: Among the CNN-based models, the contrast-agnostic model achieved the lowest CSA error.

is_compared.justification: The model's performance is compared to other models in the research findings.
is_compared.quote: Among the CNN-based models, the contrast-agnostic model achieved the lowest CSA error.

referenced_paper_title.value: Towards contrast-agnostic soft segmentation of the spinal cord
referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper references this title related to the model in its evaluation.

is_executed.quote: an open-source, pretrained SwinUNETR2 . Except for the pretrained model which we fine-tuned on our datasets...

is_compared.quote: the SwinUNETR models showed similar performance as the CNNs.

name.justification: ConvNeXt is one of the types of DL architecture studied for SC segmentation capabilities.

name.justification: The paper uses the Spine Generic Database for evaluating deep learning architectures.
name.quote: We compared 7 different DL models using the open-source Spine Generic Database of healthy participants (n = 243)

referenced_paper_title.justification: There is no referenced paper title provided for the Spine Generic Database in the paper.
